title: Highlighting
plain_text: Highlighting Rosettes provides two core functions: highlight() for HTML output and tokenize() for raw tokens. Overview Function Purpose Returns highlight() Generate HTML with syntax highlighting str (HTML) tokenize() Get raw tokens for custom processing list[Token] highlight_many() Parallel highlighting for multiple blocks list[str] tokenize_many() Parallel tokenization list[list[Token]] Quick Example from rosettes import highlight, tokenize # Get HTML output html = highlight("def foo(): pass", "python") # Get raw tokens tokens = tokenize("def foo(): pass", "python") for token in tokens: print(f"{token.type}: {token.value!r}") In This Section Code Basic Usage Using highlight() and tokenize() for syntax highlighting Cpu Parallel Processing Highlight multiple code blocks concurrently with highlight_many() List Line Highlighting Highlight specific lines and add line numbers
